docs.lead_paragraph: NATHAN C. ELY, Esq., in the Chair. ENLARGED SUPPLY OF CROTON WATER. Ald. docs.lead_paragraph: UNHEALTHINESS OF CERTAIN TRADES.--Dr. CHAMBERS read a paper the other day before the Society of Arts on Industrial Pathology. Here is an extract of much interest: "There are two coal-whippers at a time of a commercial crisis in the coal trade; fewer hands are wanted; one gets turned out of work, and the other is kept on.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE CHOLERA. The Corporation--Trouble in the Council. Music among the Newsboys. Grinding Second-avenue. A Well-Known Character Arrested. Abduction and Attempt at Murder. Abandoning a Wife. American Institute--No Fair. The Fire in Broome-street. A Hard Case. A Cloud of Witnesses. TROUBLES ON BOARD AN ENGLISH SHIP. ARREST OF A LOTTERY POLICY DEALER. TERM WEEK. YOUNG AMERICA AROUND. PRIZE ESSAY. LAUNCH. NEW-ORLEANS AND HAVANA LINE. TWELFTH REGIMENT. REDUCTION OF FARE. A NEW DODGE. CHARGE OF HIGHWAY ROBBERY. ANOTHER PRIZE FIGHT IN PROSPECT. FATAL CAMPHENE ACCIDENT. THE RIVER THIEVES. MORRISSEY THE PUGILIST, TO BE MARRIED. FUGITIVE FROM JUSTICE. RETURN OF REV. MR. WILLIAMS FROM CALIFORNIA. FATAL ACCIDENT. SUICIDE. COURT OF SESSIONS.
The Bininger Guard--Their Reception an Counadaigna--Grand Torchtight Procession--The Cholera at Niagara, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Binniger Guard were joined this morning by five additional members, who left New-York the previous night, and they all arrived a noon to-day in excellent health. The Guard were received with great enthusiasm at Canandaigua last evening. The entire Fire Department were out, and they escorted the Company to the residence of Mr. HOWELL, the Chief Engineer, in torchlight procession.

headline.main: JERSEY CITY.; The Jersey City Fire--The Burn t District. GRAND MASTER OF THE GRAND LODGE. PROHIBITION OF WOODEN BUILDINGS. JERSEY CITY CLEAN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The burnt district in Jersey City begins to show signs of life. A number of those burned out have commenced work preparatory to rebuilding, and workmen are now clearing up the ruins for that purpose, The Empire Stone Dressing Company resumed work within twenty-four hours after the fire, and have about 100 men engaged in stone-cutting.
docs.snippet: The burnt district in Jersey City begins to show signs of life. A number of those burned out have commenced work preparatory to rebuilding, and workmen are now clearing up the ruins for that purpose, The Empire Stone Dressing Company resumed work...

headline.main: THE CHARITIES OF ENGLAND.; Mr. Brace's Walks Among the Poor of Great Britain. The Liverpool Model Lodging-Houses.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is a strange thing that Society should have at length reached such an unnatural condition that it has become a business to-- as DURKE says--" remember the forgotten." And yet the world needs it as much as any other business. The class which should be the exception--the vagabond, the out-cast, the ignorant, the friendless--have come now to form a distinct body of people.

headline.main: From Now-Branswick--Ravages of the Cholera--The Reciprocity Treaty, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The St. John (New-Brunswick) papers, of Aug. 7, state that for the three days ending Aug. 6, one hundred and eleven death from Cholera occurred at St. John. The Board of Health are about o correct a temporary asylum for those children who leave lost their parents by the ravages of the disorder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite of the old saw which says otherwise. we will maintain that cleanliness is the first law of nature. The adage gives priority to self preservation, but the firs principle of health beingcleanliness, that of course is entitled to precedence.

headline.main: SARATOGA.; A Lofterer's Glennings at Seratoga--Love and Youth and Bennry.

docs.lead_paragraph: NUMBER TEN. Do you see that aged man, whose locks are hoary--who ever walks with his head bowed low upon his bosom, and his hands crossed behind, as if he were in deep thought, or the dark shadows of melancholy had settled upon his brow, or the icy hand of death had touched his heart?

docs.lead_paragraph: A great National Horse-Fair will be held at the new National Course on Long Island, on the 27th, 28th, and 29th September next, under the auspices of the National Jockey Club. The premiums to be awarded amount to $2,595. The list is liberal.
